Disease Classification
Melanoma Image Classification
Opens phone\'s camera to identify between malignant and a non-malignant melanoma.
What is Melanoma?

Melanoma occurs when the pigment-producing cells that give colour to the skin become cancerous. Melanoma develops from skin cells called Melanocytes. These are found in the deeper layers of the skin and produce a protein called melanin. Melanin protects the skin by absorbing harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation.
What are the causes of Melanoma?
1)Sun Exposure\n 2)Sunbeds
Facts about Melanoma:

1) New Zealand and Australia have the highest rates of melanoma in the world.\n 2) Melanoma is the fourth most common cancer diagnosed in New Zealand.\n 3) MƒÅori and Pacific people have a much lower chance of getting melanoma, but often have thicker (more serious) melanomas.
Eye Defect Image Classification
Opens phone\'s camera to identify whether eye defect is present.
What are Eye Defects?
Eye defects refer to the anomalous behaviour or appearance of the eye. Some of the types of eye defects are bulging eyes, cataracts, crossed eyes, glaucoma, uvetis.
Can it be cured?
Yes, eye defects can be cured.
Symptoms:

1)Blurry vision
 2)Redness
 3)Light floating spots in the field of vision.
 4)Light sensitivity.
 5)Seeing halos.
We are sorry to inform you that Eye Defects were detected in the captured sample.
What are the next steps?
Most importantly: Do Not Panic.\n Book an appointment at your nearest hospital and get tested as soon as you can.
We are sorry to inform you that Melanoma were detected in the captured sample.
What are the next steps?
Most importantly: Do Not Panic.\n Melanoma is curable in its initial stages.\n Book an appointment at your nearest hospital and get tested as soon as you can.
Q.1) Does this application save the captured pictures?
We respect the privacy of users and do not save the captured photos by any means.
Q.2) Will the application include more categories of disease classification?
Yes, in future with the available public datasets it is possible to include more categories.
Q.3) Can the application run without internet access?
Yes, the compact machine learning models used, run on users mobile device and not on the cloud making it available offline.
